joehung302 wrote:
> We're running a 10 machine crawl with the HashCrawlMapper.
> 
> What is the best way to know, give a host name, which crawler 'owns' 
> the host?

There's a static method on HashCrawlMapper, mapString, that can help:

     public static String mapString(String key, String reducePattern, 
long bucketCount)

When I've needed to do this, I have Eclipse open, with a 'scrapbook' 
page that lets you evaluate Java statements, and use that method directly.

Note that 'key' is the queue/'class' key chosen by the 
queue-assignment-policy. Assuming you're using 
SurtAuthorityAssignmentPolicy (recommended for big partitioned crawls), 
that means a String like "org,archive,www," for hostname "www.archive.org".

Note that 'reducePattern' is what you've entered in your configuration 
-- but requires Java String literal escaping of the '\' characters 
(essentially doubling them).

So for example in a 10-node crawl, to determine where "www.archive.org" 
lands, using a random reduce-pattern chosen from Igor's examples of 
April 5th, you could evaluate:

HashCrawlMapper.mapString("org,archive,www,","^((\\w\\w\\w,\\w*)|((au|uk),\\w*,\\w*)|[\\w,]{8})",10);

This could clearly be easier but that's worked for us so far.

- Gordon @ IA
